{"step_by_step_thinking": "The partograph is a graphical record of the progress of labour and relevant details of the mother and fetus. It is used to detect poor progress of labour (dystocia) and helps health care providers make decisions about whether interventions are needed to speed up labour or perform a caesarean section. The World Health Organization recommends that partograph plotting should start when the cervix is dilated 4 cm.", "answer_choice": "A"}
